column4: guys my linux install on a new laptop freezes w/o starting xorg... how can I switch off the progress screen so I can see how far it boots up and what is actually causing it to crash?
Try hitting F2 during boot, and it should display the normal console output during startup.

vasi: mbeier: I tried to remove "quiet" from the boot line and hiut F2 and F6 but nothing changed. I see the ubuntu logo with the progress indicator moving from left to right and back and the na black screen comes and its stuck there
Sounds to me like the build is boned. Did you just install or upgrade?
I installed on a virgin drive with a newly downloeded CD
talking to me about 8.1? did not try it yet. the machine is brand-new
you recommend me to try and download it?
I'm not an expert, but I would say if 8.10 works and 9.04 doesn't, maybe there's a different build/driver that changed between the old and new versions that is causing you problems.
hmm ok... let me try 8.1... thanks
Might be able to narrow it down to a build/driver problem, and in which case you could find out what your video card/chip is and people might be able to help you solve that compile/config problem.
actually ust started in recovery mode and it seems to work :-)
now I have to find out what does not work in normal mode :-)
